typography.explanation: Minimal, disciplined type with clear scale steps: large but measured H1 ('Hello, I'm Rasmus'), medium section heads ('Projects', 'Thoughts & ideas'), and small grey meta dates repeating consistently. Comfortable measures (~55–65ch in the right column) with ~1.4–1.5 leading keep dense lists readable. Links are customized (no default blue; text-weighted links with a consistent '→' cue and lighter grey meta) and casing is largely consistent. Rags are clean and there are no widows/orphans visible across long lists. Limitation: section headings are only slightly stronger than list items, making hierarchy between head and first list item a touch subtle; link states are not visible in this view.

layout_composition.explanation: Three-column grid is clear and balanced with consistent gutters; lists in left and center columns maintain even vertical rhythm and identical item spacing. Right column intro and utility tiles align to the same grid, and the vertical dot/nav stack sits neatly with optical balance. Section labels, item blocks, and 'See all' links repeat with identical offsets, showing an intentional spacing system. Limitation: heavy dark rails on page edges add visual weight and slightly compress the content; the hero heading could anchor more strongly to the grid to avoid feeling a bit floaty.

color.explanation: Tuned neutrals throughout: off-white background, off-black body text, and soft grey metas unify the dense content. Accent strategy is restrained—an orange dot and subtle grey tiles for CTAs—giving a coherent identity without noise. Value control is tight; no harsh #000/#fff pairings and no clashing hues across sections. Limitation: the very dark side gutters and differing grey fills in the right-column tiles create minor value jumps that slightly disrupt the otherwise calm palette.

typography.explanation: Clear hierarchy and disciplined styling. Observations: 1) Consistent scale system across hero, card titles, descriptions, and meta lines; small meta uses a uniform micro style with dot separators (e.g., 'Figma • 2024'). 2) Comfortable measures and leading—the right 'about' block reads ~55–70ch with ~1.4–1.6 line-height. 3) Customized labels/badges ('SHIPPED' pills) match the body weight and casing; nav uses a subtle pill state rather than default blue links. 4) Off‑black body text and tuned greys show considered neutrals. Limitation: the blurred treatment in the hero headline introduces a slightly gimmicky feel and reduces crispness/legibility at the top, and a couple of long card descriptions show mild rag/widow risk.

layout_composition.explanation: Strong grid and repeatable structure. Observations: 1) Three‑column card grid with even gutters and consistent vertical rhythm; tiles share matching radii and internal mats. 2) Hero split layout (intro left, 'about' card right) aligns to the same grid and establishes clear scan paths. 3) Repeated card pattern—title, status pill, description, and meta—maintains identical offsets, strengthening cohesion. 4) Footer is minimal and balanced, with social icons right‑aligned and credits left. Limitation: some elements feel a bit floaty in the hero (e.g., 'Currently/Previously' blocks), and a few tiles with darker backgrounds create heavier visual weight that slightly disrupts row balance.

color.explanation: Harmonious palette with tuned neutrals. Observations: 1) Warm, off‑white page background and off‑black text provide comfortable contrast without harsh #000/#fff. 2) Card backgrounds use curated, softly saturated hues that vary per project yet remain within a controlled range. 3) Status pills and borders use muted greys, showing restraint; the shell lets project colors carry interest. 4) Despite diverse imagery, consistent mats/radii and the neutral canvas unify the grid. Limitation: a couple of high‑value jumps (dark green and mustard tiles) read slightly louder than neighbors, and the blurred black hero wordmark adds a heavier value spot at the top.

typography.explanation: Readable, minimal type with a clear hierarchy. Observations: 1) Comfortable body measure (~60–70ch) with ~1.5 leading keeps paragraphs easy to scan. 2) Single sans family with restrained scale—name set heavier/larger, body regular; paragraph spacing consistent. 3) Links are underlined and uniformly colored, aiding recognition. Limitations: link styling appears default (standard blue with default underline thickness/offset, no evident hover state); hierarchy is subdued with only one heading level; the left-rail nav using light/italic treatment introduces a slightly different voice from the body without clear rationale.

layout_composition.explanation: Simple two-column structure with a narrow left rail and a content column divided by a subtle vertical rule is clear and consistent. Observations: 1) Left navigation aligns to a clean vertical grid; the divider establishes hierarchy. 2) Even vertical rhythm between paragraphs; generous outer margins. 3) Content column width is consistent; alignment is firm with no visible misalignments. Limitations: evidence limited to a single text view—no complex grids or image handling to judge; large unused space on the right at this breakpoint feels under-filled, and there are no secondary elements (captions, cards) to demonstrate more advanced composition craft.

color.explanation: Neutral palette is calm and legible. Observations: 1) Off-white background with near-black text improves readability over harsh #000/#fff. 2) Divider uses a soft grey that sits comfortably with the text. 3) Accent color is reserved for links only, keeping the shell quiet. Limitations: link hue looks default and slightly hot relative to the otherwise muted neutrals; no visible state system (hover/visited) shown; overall color voice is generic rather than distinctive.

typography.explanation: Clean, readable sans with clear scale: large bold H1 ('Hey, I’m Robin'), smaller bold H2 ('Nice to meet you'), and regular-weight body copy. Body measure sits around ~55–65ch with ~1.5 leading, producing comfortable paragraphs. Casing stays consistent (sentence case in headings, nav, and body). However, the inline 'resume' link reads like a default underline treatment (thin, uncustomized), nav text is quite light/small relative to the hero, and there’s little evidence of bespoke micro‑craft (no tuned link states, no visible baseline rhythm cues).

layout_composition.explanation: Simple two‑column grid repeated from hero to the 'Nice to meet you' section; gutters and container widths appear consistent. Generous negative space creates a calm rhythm, and the portrait photo aligns cleanly with the text column. Section breaks are clear (light divider band and a distinct footer block). Limitations: the hero’s right column is underfilled compared to the heavy H1 on the left, creating some imbalance; the tiny top‑right nav feels floaty and detached from the grid; overall structure is solid but generic with no distinctive POV.

color.explanation: Neutrals are tuned: off‑white background, near‑black text, and a soft warm‑grey footer provide gentle contrast. Color is mostly carried by the single portrait image without clashing. The light grey section band is controlled and doesn’t spike value. Limitations: no clear accent/color system is evident (links appear defaultish and slightly cool vs the warmer greys), and there’s minimal state or role differentiation shown.

typography.explanation: Very little typographic system visible beyond a simple header. The name lockup uses a plain sans in all caps with a small subtitle below but minimal scale difference. Nav labels 'Portfolio' and 'About' use title case while the name is uppercase, showing casing inconsistency. Links appear unstyled (no custom underline/offset or visible states). Project tiles have no captions or meta styles, so hierarchy for scanning is absent. Limitation: minimal body text limits assessment of rhythm and measure.

layout_composition.explanation: The page is a loose two‑column collage with inconsistent tile sizes and aspect ratios, producing irregular vertical rhythm and large blank gaps. Mixed device mocks (iMac, MacBook, iPad, iPhone) appear at different angles and scales, breaking cohesion. Several tiles are too small to read (narrow phone UI, small chat screens), and some frames bleed into the white page without mats, causing edge ambiguity. A stronger grid and consistent captions/images would improve clarity. Limitation: only one page shown, but enough tiles to judge.

color.explanation: Color is driven by disparate project imagery: saturated oranges/yellows, hot pink chat bubbles, cobalt blues, and a black poster. The shell is pure white with no unifying mats or tinted borders, so white UIs in device frames blend into the background and create flicker. No clear accent system is visible in the site chrome beyond black text. Minor positive: the neutral header avoids clashes. Limitation: states and hover colors not visible.

typography.explanation: Readable, reasonably organized type with a clear hierarchy but feels default. Evidence: 1) Large mixed‑weight H1 with yellow highlighter accents establishes focus; 2) Section headings like “I worked on…” and “What it’s like working with me” are consistent in scale and spacing with a small kicker style for TESTIMONIALS; 3) Testimonial cards show a repeated pattern (bold name, lighter role, body copy). Limitations: body text is quite small and light grey, reducing contrast; link treatment looks default (plain underline, no visible hover/state); hero paragraph runs long (~85–90ch) and the highlighter overlaps descenders, adding a touch of visual noise.

layout_composition.explanation: Clear sectional structure and adequate spacing, but image handling and a few alignments pull polish down. Evidence: 1) Consistent single-column content width with comfortable vertical rhythm between hero, projects, testimonials, logos, and footer; 2) Project tiles use repeatable cards with inset CTA placement and uniform corner radii; 3) Testimonials arranged in a disciplined grid with matched paddings and shadows. Limitations: device mockups dominate and are angled with small, unreadable UIs; one project appears partially cropped/overlapped which reads like a glitch; testimonial card heights vary, causing bottom baselines to misalign slightly.

color.explanation: A warm, friendly shell and a clear accent, but inconsistency across project tiles introduces flicker. Evidence: 1) Tuned neutrals (off‑white backgrounds, warm pale yellow testimonial band) keep the page soft; 2) A single accent yellow is used for highlighter swashes, a star, and small marks—cohesive and recognizable; 3) Greyscale client logos avoid extra noise. Limitations: project cards mix light grey and pale green backgrounds leading to rhythm/value shifts; the confetti hero background adds stray purple/green dots that compete with the yellow accent; image colors inside device shots aren’t unified, producing occasional clash.

typography.explanation: Clear, readable sans system with a consistent scale: bold hero headline with ~55–65ch measure and comfortable leading; repeating small grey meta labels for 'Selected Works' and 'Past Projects'; tile titles and captions use predictable size/weight steps. Nav shows a selected state (darker 'Home') and avoids default blue underlines. Limitations: voice feels generic (system/Inter‑like), no visible custom link styling or state system beyond nav, and mixed casing conventions (sentence case hero vs Title Case section labels) reduce cohesion.

layout_composition.explanation: Solid structure: balanced two‑column hero (left text, right portrait with rounded corners), followed by a disciplined 2×2 project grid with equal card dimensions, consistent corner radii, and even gutters; section breaks and spacing are clean. Cards have clear internal hierarchy and ample mats. Limitations: fairly boilerplate composition with little POV; internal asset treatment varies (screenshots vs illustration vs line art with different internal scales) causing slight rhythm flicker; a floaty 'back to top' arrow adds a minor out‑of‑system element.

color.explanation: Harmonious palette: tuned neutrals (off‑black text on soft white), cohesive pastel mats across cards (lavender, butter, peach) that unify diverse imagery, and subtle shadows that keep value range controlled. Grayscale portrait avoids competing hues and sits comfortably in the shell. Limitations: a couple of tiles push saturation/value (bright orange 'Type Design' and green illustration) introducing small jumps; link/CTA color system is not clearly expressed beyond nav state.

typography.explanation: Readable sans-serif system with clear hierarchy: large hero 'I am Jiyoung' paired with a comfortable ~55–65ch paragraph and ~1.4–1.6 leading. Captions under tiles use a smaller meta style that repeats. Neutrals on the dark hero are tuned (off‑black/teal background, white text) and contrast is adequate. Limitations: link/CTA system is generic (outline 'More about me' with no visible state; 'See projects' uses a down arrow rather than clear link styling), casing is mixed (hero sentence case vs Title Case in nav and project labels), and the typographic voice reads default/inter‑like with little customization.

layout_composition.explanation: Solid baseline structure: left‑text/right‑visual hero with ample negative space; top nav aligned cleanly; two‑column project grid keeps consistent gutters and left‑aligned captions. Assets are generally crisp and not cut off. Limitations: image presentation is inconsistent—some tiles use grey device mats, others are raw screenshots, one is an angled 3D spread—creating rhythm flicker; tile heights vary noticeably, breaking vertical cadence; a floaty 'See projects' chevron sits off grid. Overall reads like a common template rather than a bespoke system.

color.explanation: Controlled shell: dark teal hero with off‑white text feels considered, and the rest of the page shifts to a clean white canvas. Accents are restrained and don't clash with content. Limitations: project tiles introduce many disparate backgrounds (pure white, light grey, dark UI, multicolor print spread) without unifying mats or border tints, causing visual flicker; the outline button on dark feels slightly low‑impact; state colors are not evident.

typography.explanation: Readable, conservative sans/serif mix with a clear 'Featured work' heading and small, tidy nav. Links appear in default blue with default underline/weight and no visible hover treatment. Body copy uses a comfortable single measure and sentence case, but hierarchy is thin (single headline size, little variation in meta styles). Overall feels template-like rather than a tuned system.

layout_composition.explanation: Simple single-column stack with ample whitespace and consistent container width. However, image handling is weak: one tile is a wide collage with tiny unreadable UI, the next is a generic phone mock with heavy device chrome; aspect ratios and internal mats differ, causing rhythm flicker. The centered intro + 'Featured work' label reads as stock module usage; minimal section structure beyond two tiles.

color.explanation: Shell is neutral, but lacks tuning (reads like pure black on white with default link blue). Project tiles clash: first uses a dark navy gradient background, second uses a light desaturated blue; no unifying mat/border system so values jump between tiles. Accents are uncontrolled, coming from the screenshots rather than a defined palette.

typography.explanation: Readable serif headline with comfortable measure (~45–55ch) and relaxed leading; nav uses a restrained sans for contrast; project titles and small meta sit consistently under each tile. Footer links use simple underlines that are legible on black. Limitations: the hero lines appear manually broken, producing a poem-like rag and uneven rhythm; link treatment looks defaultish with no visible hover/state system; the prefixed period before project titles (e.g., ". Shutterfly Brand Transformation") feels arbitrary and introduces punctuation inconsistency.

layout_composition.explanation: A clear two-column grid is used throughout with consistent gutters; alternating spans (half/half → full-width → half/half) are orderly; captions align left with repeatable offsets beneath tiles. Generous whitespace around the hero creates breathing room. Limitations: mixed image treatments (device mocks on gradients vs flat brand panels) create rhythm flicker; the heavy full-width black footer interrupts the otherwise light vertical flow; several device screenshots are small/unreadable, reducing the effectiveness of the image-first layout.

color.explanation: Neutral shell (white background, dark grey text) keeps content readable; warm oranges and cool blues in project tiles create contrast without clashing; the deep navy panel is controlled. Limitations: no clear accent system across text and links; adjacent tiles jump between saturated orange and blue gradients with no unifying mats/borders; the abrupt, very dark footer is a jarring value shift compared to the light page above.

typography.explanation: Typographic system is disciplined and distinctive. 1) Oversized, left‑anchored section heads (“Column”, “Webflow Brand”, “Samsung”, etc.) use a consistent weight and scale with generous but repeatable offsets to the grid. 2) Small meta rows above each grid are set in a lighter tone with tight, even leading and identical label structure across sections, showing a clear scale system. 3) Rags are controlled (e.g., deliberate line break in “Webflow Dot Com”), with stable baselines and no widows/orphans visible. 4) Navigation and micro labels maintain consistent casing/weight, and badges align optically to text. Limitation: link/hover state styling isn’t evident from the capture and some body copy examples are sparse, so state logic can’t be verified.

layout_composition.explanation: Highly refined structure with a strong POV. 1) Each section repeats a clear two‑zone layout: a wide left column for the title and meta, and a right 3‑column image grid with identical tile sizes and consistent gutters. 2) Vertical rhythm is impeccable—uniform spacing between title, metadata, divider, and grid repeats throughout the long page. 3) Image handling is disciplined: matching tile aspect ratios, coherent internal mats, and no cut‑off crops; grids align perfectly across rows and sections. 4) Section dividers and left‑column anchors keep scan paths predictable without center/left drift. Limitation: a few tiles mix dark and very light scenes which introduces mild value jumps, though the grid still holds together.

color.explanation: Neutral shell is tuned and lets imagery carry color. 1) Off‑white background and off‑black text avoid harsh #000/#fff contrast. 2) Meta rows use a softer grey, providing a secondary hierarchy without noise. 3) Imagery spans saturated purples/blues/oranges but sits comfortably due to consistent white gallery background and unified tile mats. 4) The orange sticky note hero reads as a single confident accent without clashing. Limitation: because thumbnails include both very dark and very light compositions, occasional value flicker appears within some rows; link/CTA color states aren’t visible.

typography.explanation: Distinct pairing: elegant serif for section headings and a clean sans for body/meta creates clear hierarchy. Comfortable measures (roughly 55–70ch) with generous 1.4–1.6 leading keep long paragraphs readable. Headline scale and spacing are disciplined (consistent H2 size/weight and tracking across each project section). Links and CTAs are customized (subtle arrow/label treatment instead of default blue underlines). Rags look tidy with no obvious widows/orphans. Limitation: some micro text in the hero/meta columns feels quite small and low‑contrast, which slightly reduces clarity.

layout_composition.explanation: Strong, repeated section structure: left-aligned headings with right-aligned meta, followed by full-width image tiles, yields a consistent scan pattern. Spacing system feels measured (even vertical rhythm; consistent gutters and image widths; square corners carried through). Image handling is considered—crisp, high‑res mocks with coherent mats and no mismatched radii. The dark footer forms a clear terminus and introduces a tasteful icon grid motif that echoes the page’s subtle grid marks above sections. Limitation: image heights vary notably (e.g., the diagonal Airbase collage) which slightly breaks vertical rhythm, and the decorative hero circle competes a bit with the content column.

color.explanation: Tuned neutrals: warm off‑white background and soft off‑black text avoid harsh #000/#fff. Accents are sparing and mostly carried by imagery; the shell stays restrained, letting colorful project visuals sit without clashing. The dark navy footer adds contrast but remains harmonious; multi‑color icon grid is subdued and consistent in value. Limitation: some projects swing from very light pastels to very dark UIs, creating noticeable value jumps; the footer’s value shift is strong and could feel heavy on smaller screens.

typography.explanation: Editorial sans with a confident display scale; the hero headline is multi-line with even rags and comfortable leading. Links are customized as black text with a clean underline (not default blue). Project captions repeat a disciplined micro‑label system (title → short description → location/year) with consistent sizes and spacing. Section headings (“Projects”, “About”) reuse the same display style, reinforcing hierarchy. Limitation: neutrals appear closer to pure #000/#fff and some meta text runs a bit small/tight, with limited evidence of hover/state nuance.

layout_composition.explanation: Clear grid and spacing system throughout: wide hero photo, then a well‑paced vertical drop into content; the two‑column project grid has matching heights, even gutters, and captions aligned with identical offsets. The About section uses a strong split layout (photo left; services/clients/locations/press columns right) that sits on a consistent baseline rhythm; the Contact button is placed intentionally at the bottom right of the grid. Image crops are clean with no mismatched radii or shadows, and margins are consistent. Limitation: the gap between the intro copy and the Projects header is slightly generous and the heavy footer‑like About block feels visually dense in this viewport.

color.explanation: Minimal, disciplined palette: monochrome shell (black/white) lets vibrant product photography carry color without clashing. The black About section creates deliberate contrast while maintaining readability with white text; the gray Contact button provides a softer accent. Link color is harmonized with body text (black underline) rather than default blue. Limitation: reliance on pure black/white reads a bit stark; states/hover colors aren’t visible, and the dark About band is a strong value jump that could be softened with tuned neutrals.

typography.explanation: Readable sans but largely default. 1) Hero uses a very heavy display weight with tight tracking that overpowers the page; supporting blurb runs long (≈90ch) with slightly tight leading. 2) Link treatment feels defaultish/undefined—'See all Work' is a plain grey text link with no clear underline/hover system while a separate coral 'Contact' pill uses a different voice. 3) Inconsistent casing and micro-labels: 'Selected work' (sentence case) sits next to title‑case project names and all‑caps company tags; an emoji at the end of the hero blurb breaks typographic tone. Hierarchy is serviceable but generic, with limited evidence of tuned rhythm or custom link states. Limitation: copy remains legible and sizes are sensible overall.

layout_composition.explanation: Structure reads like a standard template: centered intro then a vertical list of projects with large hero mock followed by title/description. 1) Project tiles mix presentation styles (angled card stacks, a large 3D monitor with big white mat, overlapping browser windows, a dark phone render) producing uneven tile heights and rhythm. 2) Shadows and framing vary across tiles (different angles/intensities) and some device renders make UI content small/unreadable relative to the mat. 3) Section label 'Selected work' and 'See all Work' feel loosely anchored with generous but inconsistent vertical spacing above/below items. While the grid is basically aligned, there’s little evidence of a coherent spacing system or bespoke structure. Limitation: overall flow is scannable and alignment to the main column is consistent.

color.explanation: Color system lacks cohesion. 1) Shell uses stark white with near‑black text; neutrals don’t appear tuned. 2) Accents are unclear: a lone coral 'Contact' pill is not repeated elsewhere; links and labels don’t share a defined accent scheme. 3) Project tiles introduce disparate mats (cool blue, neutral grey, warm beige) plus a dark phone render, causing value and hue flicker as you scroll; blue‑heavy screenshots clash with the coral accent, with no unifying borders or tints. Limitation: contrast is adequate for readability.

typography.explanation: Readable overall, but multiple issues reduce polish. 1) Section headings use a playful script ('My Work', 'My Process', 'Contact') that clashes with the sans body and weakens hierarchy. 2) Several text blocks are too small: project tile captions and the testimonial paragraph look ~11–12px with tight line-height, hurting legibility. 3) Mixed heading styles/casing across sections (script headings vs title‑case 'Connect With Me' vs centered hero headline) suggest no clear type scale. 4) Nav/link styling is minimal with no evident hover/state system. Positives: hero paragraph has a comfortable measure (~60–70ch) and off‑black tone. Limitation: lacks a disciplined, repeating scale and consistent heading system.

layout_composition.explanation: Structure is competent with clear sections and adequate spacing. 1) The 3‑up project grid sits in a rounded container with even gutters; process uses a balanced 2‑up card layout; contact section is a left text/right image split. 2) Card radii and soft shadows are consistent, giving cohesion. 3) Alignment is mostly kept, though there are rough spots: the carousel arrow overlaps a project tile edge awkwardly; the testimonial area nests a rounded card inside another rounded container creating visual clutter; the large arched photo in 'Contact' floats and doesn't align to the left column baseline, making the section feel unanchored. 4) Background gradient bands create additional visual breaks that sometimes compete with content. Limitation: lacks refined optical alignment and overuses nested rounded boxes.

color.explanation: Warm neutral palette is coherent: taupe gradients, beige cards, and off‑black text keep a consistent tone; shadows/borders appear softly tinted. Project overlays use white text for adequate contrast. However, 1) several small text areas (hero copy, testimonial) use mid‑grey on beige, pushing contrast too low. 2) The multi‑stop background gradients add noise and value shifts behind content, causing mild readability flicker. 3) Accent elements (brown carousel arrow, underlines) are subdued to the point of low emphasis. Limitation: improve contrast and reduce gradient intensity to strengthen focus.

typography.explanation: Readable, mostly consistent system. Evidence: 1) Large all‑caps hero in a geometric sans with generous tracking; clean, even baseline. 2) Subheadline uses spaced small caps with dot separators; nav shows consistent small caps (WORK / PLAY / ABOUT). 3) Project captions repeat a small label + thin meta line with a year, giving a clear secondary style; body copy in the contact block sits around a comfortable ~60–70ch with ~1.4 leading. Limitations: link styling in the contact column appears default-ish underlined with no visible state; casing/voice varies ("Let's chat!" vs "Contact"); the hero wordmark is slightly over‑tracked and feels a bit blunt; no visible hover/visited patterns.

layout_composition.explanation: Cohesive, intentional structure with a clear POV. Evidence: 1) Single-column grid with consistent container width and generous top/bottom spacing creates a steady vertical rhythm. 2) Three project tiles share identical widths and similar heights; captions align bottom-left with matching offsets, indicating a disciplined card pattern. 3) Collage-style mats (paper textures, tape, doodles) are centered and balanced, harmonizing varied screenshots without awkward crops; section transition from hero to work via a patterned divider is clean and deliberate. 4) Footer uses a tidy two-column grid aligned to the main container. Limitations: first project relies on device frames which make the UI small; minimal layout variation beyond the stacked cards; a "Made in Framer" badge floats and slightly breaks polish.

color.explanation: Color is distinctive yet controlled. Evidence: 1) Rich maroon hero with off‑white type provides strong contrast without harsh #000/#fff. 2) Muted collage backgrounds (olive, teal, kraft, burgundy) with paper textures unify mixed imagery and keep saturation in check. 3) The green patterned strip acts as a consistent accent and creates a clear section break; text neutrals read as softened black/grey. Limitations: the playful green pattern can skew juvenile and slightly clash with a professional tone; tile background values vary (olive vs teal) causing mild value flicker between projects; limited evidence of interactive color states.

typography.explanation: Readable sans with a clear headline and consistent card titles; hero paragraph has a comfortable ~55–65ch measure and adequate 1.4–1.6 leading; small meta text under project titles repeats predictably. However, links in the hero appear default bright blue with default underline and no visible hover/state; light gray body/meta copy in cards is a bit low‑contrast; an emoji callout (🔔 Case Study Coming Soon!) reads informal and breaks typographic tone. Overall competent but generic.

layout_composition.explanation: Two‑column staggered grid is consistent with even gutters; cards share matching radii and shadow treatment; section spacing feels measured (hero → grid → CTA). The masonry offsets introduce mild raggedness and uneven bottoms; mixed asset styles (flat screenshots vs a rendered phone) reduce cohesion; footer social row and CTA block feel like standard modules rather than a strong POV. Solid, not refined.

color.explanation: Pastel mats (yellow, blue, orange, purple, green, pink, aqua) are soft and generally harmonious; off‑black text on white shell keeps readability; shadows are subtle. Yet the many hues introduce visual flicker across the grid, and there isn’t a clear accent system beyond defaultish blue links; some card captions use very light gray reducing contrast. Competent but not tightly controlled.

typography.explanation: Readable serif with comfortable leading (~1.5) and a clear hierarchy: company names set heavier, role beneath lighter, and dates in consistent italics with proper en dashes (e.g., “September 2022 – Current”). Rags are tidy and paragraphs are spaced evenly. Links are customized (warm accent on the email; nav links not default blue). Limitations: the opening paragraph runs quite wide (approaching >85–90ch), reducing readability; nav casing is inconsistent (“Product design” vs “Illustration”/“About”); limited evidence of link/hover state system.

layout_composition.explanation: Structure is clear and repeatable: a two‑column pattern with company/role on the left and a right‑aligned date column, repeated consistently across entries. Vertical rhythm between sections is measured; ‘View work’ outline buttons sit in the same position each time; footer icons align on a central column. Limitations: the hero paragraph spans wider than the content column and feels floaty; overall layout is conventional with little point‑of‑view; no visual anchors beyond text to guide scanning.

color.explanation: Muted neutrals and off‑black text keep the page calm; subtle grey 1px strokes on outline buttons match the body tone; social icons use a single desaturated grey; a restrained warm accent highlights the email link without clashing. Limitations: accent usage is sparse and states aren’t evident (no clear hover/active cues); the palette is safe and doesn’t add cohesion beyond neutrality.

typography.explanation: Readable sans system with clear hierarchy: hero headline in a heavier weight with comfortable measure (~45–60ch), section headers (Selected Work, About, Fun) repeat a consistent size/weight, and project meta lines use a lighter tone for contrast. Lists in “With Experiences of” are aligned into neat columns and body copy in About has adequate leading. Limits: voice feels generic; capitalization and labels vary (“Read More” vs “Contact Me!”; Title Case vs sentence case), and there’s little evidence of customized link styling or micro‑craft (no tuned underlines, no visible hover states). Paragraph rags are acceptable but not particularly refined.

layout_composition.explanation: Overall grid is clear and consistent: single‑column project list with even vertical rhythm, uniform thumbnail aspect ratios and matching rounded corners (~16–24px), and a tidy two‑column About section with balanced image/text. Experience rows are separated by subtle dividers and aligned columns. Limits: case imagery is placed inside generic device scenes with blurred backgrounds, making screenshots small and hard to read; CTAs on cards float at varying positions (“Read More” vs “Contact Me!”) creating slight alignment inconsistency; the large grey “Coming Soon” placeholder in Fun disrupts polish and rhythm.

color.explanation: Monochrome shell (black text on white) keeps things coherent; sparse black pill CTAs provide a single accent; travel thumbnails are harmonized with a muted/mono treatment. Limits: project thumbnails include mixed warm/cool blurred backdrops that don’t fully unify with the otherwise minimal palette; the heavy black pills can feel visually loud against a light system; the large mid‑grey placeholder block adds an unintended focal point.
